item.title: Choosing Dark Fiber vs Lit Fiber Service
item.description:
When applications require the bandwidth of fiber optic transmission, businesses face a choice: use existing “lit” fiber services or establish their own transport services using purchased or leased “dark” fiber. Deciding between these options involves weighing performance, cost, and installation time. Focusing solely on cost can lead to extended installation delays, potentially impacting operational needs. While a cost-effective solution might be suitable with ample planning time, immediate bandwidth demands may necessitate prioritizing availability over cost...

item.title: Fiber Optic DWDM Up to 100 Gbps Per Wavelength
item.description:
The demand for bandwidth keeps increasing, even during economic slowdowns. The main reason is the huge popularity of video, especially high-definition video, which needs a lot of bandwidth on all types of networks. Now, fiber optic systems using DWDM (Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing) can handle 100 Gbps per wavelength. It seems like just yesterday we were excited about moving from 10 Gbps to 40 Gbps channels. Now, Alcatel-Lucent offers an upgrade that handles both 40 Gbps and 100 Gbps on a single optical carrier for their 1830 Photonic Service Switch (PSS)...
